payload.name: game-theoretic-strategic
payload.core: Analyze situations where your outcome depends on others' choices, and theirs on yours. Core question: What should I do, given that they're optimizing too?

out.valid: options mutually exclusive and collectively exhaustive

proc: map payoffs per action combination (ordinal if cardinal unknown)
determine info structure (simultaneous, sequential, repeated, private)
find equilibria (pure Nash first, mixed if none)

diff.decision-theoretic: treats world as passive; game theory treats agents as strategic optimizers
diff.theory-of-mind: ToM infers beliefs; game theory derives actions from optimization
diff.mechanism-design: MD designs game rules; game theory plays given rules
diff.negotiation: uses game theory but adds norms, trust, process
diff.adversarial: asks how could fail; game theory asks what will rational opponents do

fail.mode: assuming rationality and common knowledge where absent
signals: model predicts X, reality delivers Y
mit: test behavioral deviations (epsilon-greedy, prospect theory, anchoring)
check common-knowledge failures, model as Bayesian game
add robustness buffer for brittle strategies

ex.problem: Two cloud providers deciding whether to cut prices
ex.recommendation: One-shot: Cut. Repeated: signal Hold if reciprocated, retaliate if deviation
